pullRequest.title: Improve Record Parser tests
pullRequest.bodyText:
Detailed description:
These tests have been really painful to modify in the past and continue to be hinderance in major record parser changes. If we had time to refactor them before, that would have also made previous refactors easier. Latest, they were causing pain when I was trying out 1 column vs 2 columns approaches for entities. Took some extra time out on the weekend to fix these.

Change touches only test files
99% code is just refactoring.
1% non-refactor: For sharing TransactionRecord builder code in AbstractEntityRecordItemListenerTest, I had to fix the logic around transfer list.

Clearly defined PAYER account. Shared code adds only the fee transfers.
Change in expected entity count in many places is due to this fix.


Removed EntityRecordItemListenerCryptoTest#verifyRepoCryptoTransferList() since it was duplicating the check already done by assertRecord(). assertRecord() already verifies that all transfers in TransactionRecord are present in the table. In fact, verifyRepoCryptoTransferList() works incorrect for the case when transfer list contains two transfers for same entity.
Enabled the 2 disabled tests. I couldn't understand why they were failing, let's reenable and see.
Removed unnecessary variable assignments (there were too many in crypto tests)

Couldn't get to everything, there are just so many. Will need another iteration in future.
Signed-off-by: Apekshit Sharma apekshit.sharma@hedera.com
Which issue(s) this PR fixes:
Special notes for your reviewer:
Checklist

 Documentation added
 Tests updated

Improve Record Parser tests

These tests have been really painful to modify in the past and continue to be hinderance in major record parser changes.
If we had time to refactor them before, that would have also made previous refactors easier. Latest, they were causing
pain when I was trying out 1 column vs 2 columns approaches for entities. Took some extra time out on the weekend to fix these.

- Change touches only test files
- 99% code is just refactoring.
- 1% non-refactor: For sharing TransactionRecord builder code in AbstractEntityRecordItemListenerTest, I had to fix the
  logic around transfer list.
  - Clearly defined PAYER account. Shared code adds only the fee transfers.
  - Change in expected entity count in many places is due to this fix.
- Removed EntityRecordItemListenerCryptoTest#verifyRepoCryptoTransferList() since it was duplicating the check already done by assertRecord().
  assertRecord() already verifies that all transfers in TransactionRecord are present in the table. In fact, verifyRepoCryptoTransferList()
  works incorrect for the case when transfer list contains two transfers for same entity.
- Enabled the 2 disabled tests. I couldn't understand why they were failing, let's reenable and see.
- Removed unnecessary variable assignments (there were too many in crypto tests)

Couldn't get to everything, there are just so many. Will need another iteration in future.

Signed-off-by: Apekshit Sharma <apekshit.sharma@hedera.com>

nodes.bodyText: shared common Transaction and TransactionRecord builder code here.

entity count change is because:
entities before:

98, 3, 2002 from transfer list
2 from defaultTransactionBodyBuilder#setTransactionID
proxy account and contract account
The flaw here is that there is no transfer list denoting fee transfer from payer to node & treasury.

entities now:

98, 2002, 3 from transfer list. 2002 is also the payer now.
proxy account and contract account

Similar case in other test classes too.

Would try to move isDeleted check to assertContractEntity() in future. It's better there.
Same in other test classes.
Should be 2 as it can only contain the node and network fee. See comment above

commit.message:
Improve Record Parser tests

These tests have been really painful to modify in the past and continue to be hinderance in major record parser changes.
If we had time to refactor them before, that would have also made previous refactors easier. Latest, they were causing
pain when I was trying out 1 column vs 2 columns approaches for entities. Took some extra time out on the weekend to fix these.

- Change touches only test files
- 99% code is just refactoring.
- 1% non-refactor: For sharing TransactionRecord builder code in AbstractEntityRecordItemListenerTest, I had to fix the
  logic around transfer list.
  - Clearly defined PAYER account. Shared code adds only the fee transfers.
  - Change in expected entity count in many places is due to this fix.
- Removed EntityRecordItemListenerCryptoTest#verifyRepoCryptoTransferList() since it was duplicating the check already done by assertRecord().
  assertRecord() already verifies that all transfers in TransactionRecord are present in the table. In fact, verifyRepoCryptoTransferList()
  works incorrect for the case when transfer list contains two transfers for same entity.
- Enabled the 2 disabled tests. I couldn't understand why they were failing, let's reenable and see.
- Removed unnecessary variable assignments (there were too many in crypto tests)

Couldn't get to everything, there are just so many. Will need another iteration in future.

Signed-off-by: Apekshit Sharma <apekshit.sharma@hedera.com>
